ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I think this material is very useful and I really enjoyed reading stochastic processes textbooks and working through problems. However, as it is, this course was poorly organized, and I would not recommend it unless there would be significant changes made. Otherwise, I would recommend to any student interested in stochastic processes to take the MITX online course (I completed the materials for that course simultaneously with this one, because I did not feel I was learning in this course).
Would recommend for students with a little statistic background
Good knowledge, but it might be a better idea to just learn it yourself.
It is a great course for people who want to know renewal processes and markov chains.
It gives a brief introduction of different random processes. I would recommend it to students who is interested in statistics.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As mentioned above, I believe the material for stochastic processes will be very important to my future research. I did not feel that this course contributed greatly to my understanding of that material, however, and I would have learned as much had I done exclusively independent research.
My research is going to involve some stochastic process analysis. I think this course will be helpful for my research

If you want to start learning concepts about Stochastic processes, it just covers everything you need. Renewal processes, conditional expectation, markov chains... I feel confident to start with things related to them now.
increase my interest in the area
It is a very good introduction to stochastic process.
